content: Why does so much of the discourse in America revolve around ethnic groups? Do you guys realize how many different “shades” of “white people” there are? This is not a homogeneous group of people you’re talking about here. Racism exists, of that I have no doubt. I have personally been on the receiving end a couple of times. That said, this isn’t a fight between “white vs black” because frankly what is going on is a lot more gray than what I’ve reading here. The color of the person’s skin is only the tip of the iceberg when it comes to racism. “White people” are racist against other “white people” every single day and not enough is being said about the racism expressed by “black people” against people of differing ethnic groups. So to recap: please break the stereotype of this being a white vs black thing. It’s much bigger than that. Often you are being discriminated against due to internal office politics and (as other commentators have mentioned) the same happens to “white people” on a daily basis.
